getEntities

public java.util.ArrayList<edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.Entity> getEntities(java.lang.String query)
General query for MeSH. Uses the built-in search function and returns the top 5 results.

Specified by:
getEntities in interface edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.ResourceWrapper
Parameters:
query - String of search terms to query with
Returns:
ArrayList of of items found using query, null on error

getEntities

public java.util.ArrayList<edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.Entity> getEntities(java.lang.String query,
                                                                                     boolean exactMatch)
Similar to getEntities(query), the name of the items found with query must exactly match (case-insensitive) query.

Specified by:
getEntities in interface edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.ResourceWrapper
Parameters:
query - String of search terms to query with
exactMatch - boolean flag for an exact match test on each item
Returns:
ArrayList of exact matches

getEntityById

public edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.Entity getEntityById(java.lang.String id)
MeSh does not contain ID's from other systems and so there is nothing to go into the Entity ID field. It does have unique identifiers for internal use, but those aren't found elsewhere. Leaving it unimplemented, as any implementation would be more confusing than helpful.

Specified by:
getEntityById in interface edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.ResourceWrapper

getEntityById

public edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.Entity getEntityById(java.lang.String id,
                                                                  boolean exactMatch)
See getEntityByID(String query), same thing applies

Specified by:
getEntityById in interface edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.ResourceWrapper
